summary: Legally parking too close to crosswalk
description: Please move the allowed parking area further from the crosswalk and the intersection so pedestrians can be seen and so pedestrians can see vehicles driving in their direction before they start crossing the crosswalk.  The current parking signage and markings here allow cars to park so close to this crosswalk on Maryland Avenue that drivers and walkers alike can't see each other until it is too late.  It is particularly bad when a tall vehicle, SUV, or truck is parked near the crosswalk.  The photo only illustrates the intersection, not the problem, because the pic only shows a small car.
address: 650 Maryland Ave Ne Washington, District of Columbia

summary: New bike path bi-directional signage needs new location
description:
The new bike bi-directional signs on both sides of  G Street at 12th Street NE are in tree boxes too far from the corner and will be hidden from car drivers driving north or south on 12th Street and need to be put on new posts closer to the intersection.

The sign for drivers driving north on 12th is not directly facing the intersection for drivers to see because the angle of the post was initially intended only for parking signs.  More importantly, as soon as the trees in the tree boxes have leaves these signs will not be visible to drivers.  See the attached pic for example.  Without moving the signs to new posts, cars will not see the signage and DC could be held liable in some accidents.
